Don't let the initial price tag scare you away from applying. If you have real talent in the arts and/or you are a scholar, there is financial aid.

With classes 2.5 hours long (twice a week), we are able to really get into the topics. The professors know what they're talking about and are passionate about their subject. Getting a job quickly after graduation is very important at SCAD.

Again, go to community college first, get the easy stuff over with. I can't imagine getting the things like english and math over while I'm there. Everything is really fast paced and intense so you'd be better of going somewhere else first and transferring. textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Jessica from Savannah, GA 07/14/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 40 out of 40 people found this review useful. 2 of 218 Categories Comments Great for these types of students SCAD is perfect for anyone pursuing a career in the art and design fields, especially students who are dedicated and willing to put in a lot of work. Tips for prospective students Make sure that you submit your absolute best work in your portfolio, and write a good essay, make sure it meets the required three pages. Also you want to make sure that you get really good recommendation letters from your teachers. Bang for the buck SCAD is on the expensive side, but it is worth every penny! Just make sure to apply to as many scholarships as you can. Am enjoying being here It is a wonderful environment, all of the new people you meet
